noun.description: Abrupt evolutionary change; sudden large-scale mutation.
examples: new genetic characters appear suddenly by saltation
a new concept of evolution by saltations or sudden transitions

noun.description: The movement of hard particles such as sand over an uneven surface in a turbulent flow of air or water.
examples: the distance traveled by each grain during saltation

noun.description: The action of leaping or dancing.

origin: Early 17th century (in saltation (sense 3)): from Latin saltatio(n-), from saltare to dance, frequentative of salire to leap.
